ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Assetbundle
Custom_Assetbundle
ObjectStates.Description: Click on the handle to close.
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
local ConcealedStorageHeight = 3.0
local ConceiledStorageOffset = 10000.0
local StorageState = 1

local BB = {
	Min = {
		x = -16.0,
		y = 41.99,
		z = -50.0
	},
	Max = {
		x = 16.0,
		y = 41.99,
		z = -32.0
	}
}

function onLoad()
    self.interactable = false;
	
    self.createButton({
		label = "",
		click_function = "onButtonClick",
		function_owner = self,
		width = 1000,
		height = 750,
		color = {1, 0, 0, 0.0},
		position = {0, 40.7, 50.5},
		rotation = {-90, 0, 0},
		font_size = 200
    })
	
	if self.getStateId() ~= StorageState then
    Timer.create({
        identifier = ("onAfterLoad" .. self.guid),
        function_name = "onAfterLoad",
        delay = 0.2
    })
	end
end

function onAfterLoad()
	local pos = self.getPosition()
	local bounds = self.getBoundsNormalized()
	local rot = self.getRotation()
	local direction = 1.0
	
	if rot.y == 0 then
		direction = -1.0
	end
	
	BB.Min.x = BB.Min.x + pos.x
	BB.Min.y = BB.Min.y + pos.y - 1.5
	BB.Min.z = (BB.Min.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	BB.Max.x = 	BB.Max.x + pos.x
	BB.Max.y = 	BB.Max.y + pos.y + ConcealedStorageHeight + 0.5
	BB.Max.z = (BB.Max.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	HideObjectsAbove( false )
end

function onButtonClick()
	local currentState = self.getStateId()
	local nextState = 1 + (currentState % 2)
	
	if currentState ~= StorageState then
		HideObjectsAbove( true )
	end
	
	self.setState( nextState )
end

function HideObjectsAbove( toggle )
    local objectsAbove = {}
	local BBMin = { x = BB.Min.x, y = BB.Min.y, z = BB.Min.z }
	local BBMax = { x = BB.Max.x, y = BB.Max.y, z = BB.Max.z }
	
	if not toggle then
		BBMin.y = BBMin.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
		BBMax.y = BBMax.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
	end
    
    for k,v in pairs( getAllObjects() ) do
        if v != self then
            if PointToAABBIntersect( BBMin, BBMax, v.getPosition() ) then
                if toggle then
                    Store( v )
                else
                    Dispense( v )
                end
            end
        end
    end
end

-- Assumes ||min|| < ||max||
function PointToAABBIntersect( min, max, point )
    if IsInRange( point.x, min.x, max.x ) and
       IsInRange( point.y, min.y, max.y ) and
       IsInRange( point.z, min.z, max.z ) then
	   return true
    end
    
    return false
end

function IsInRange( value, a, b )
	local min = 0
	local max = 0
	
	if a > b then
		max = a
		min = b
	else
		max = b
		min = a
	end
	
	if value > min and value < max then
		return true
	end
	
	return false
end

function Store( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local isLocked = obj.getLock()
	
	obj.setVar( "LockStatus", isLocked )
	
    obj.interactable = false
    obj.setLock( true )
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y - ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
end

function Dispense( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local originalLockStatus = obj.getVar( "LockStatus" )
	
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y + ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
	
    obj.interactable = true
	
	if originalLockStatus ~= nil and originalLockStatus == true then
		obj.setLock( true )
	else
		obj.setLock( false )
	end
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model_Infinite_Bag
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--Roll-O-Matic by MrStump

--CUSTOMIZATION VARIABLES BEGIN HERE

--Distance the dice are placed from the tool
radius = 3
--How high (relative to the tool) the dice are placed
height = 5
--How many seconds after the dice come to rest before they are auto-cleaned
--If you want cleanup with no delay after roll results, use 0
--A value of -1 will cause them not to be cleaned up automatically
cleanupAfterRoll = -1
--If the results of the roll are printed, true or false
printRollResults = false
--If the roll results are put into order or left as they are
--Only applies to the printing of roll results, the dice are not impacted
organizeRollResults = true

--END OF CUSTOMIZATION VARIABLES

function onSave()
    local data_to_save = {da=diceActive, wd=watchingDice}
    saved_data = JSON.encode(data_to_save)
    return saved_data
end

function onLoad(saved_data)
    if saved_data ~= "" then
        --Set up information off of loaded_data
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        diceActive = loaded_data.da
        watchingDice = loaded_data.wd
    else
        diceActive = {}
        watchingDice = false
    end

    createButtons()
end

--Activated by button press, pulls dice and starts process
function numberButtonPressed(num, color)
    if watchingDice == false then
        --Delete old dice if they exist
        if #diceActive > 0 then
            deleteCurrentDice()
        end
        watchingDice = true
        math.randomseed(os.time())
        local bagPos, bagRot = self.getPosition(), self.getRotation()
        for i=1, num do
            --Create Position
            local pos = getRadialPosition(i, num, bagPos, bagRot)
            --Create random rotation
            local rot = randomRotation()
            --Removes objects from bag
            self.takeObject({
                position=pos, rotation=rot,
                callback="afterSpawn", callback_owner=self, params={color=color, num=num}
            })
        end
    else
        --Error if you try to roll dice again before the first set finishes
        broadcastToColor("Dice are already being rolled.", color, {0.8,0.2,0.2})
    end
end
--Callback, runs after dice are spawned
function afterSpawn(die, params)
    table.insert(diceActive, die.getGUID())
    if #diceActive == params.num then
        self.setVar("colorForCoroutine", params.color)
        startLuaCoroutine(self, "watchDice")
    end
end

--Coroutine, watching for all the dice to come to rest.
function watchDice()
    local color = self.getVar("colorForCoroutine")
    local startTime = os.time()
    repeat
        local restingCount = 0
        for i, dieGUID in ipairs(diceActive) do
            local die = getObjectFromGUID(dieGUID)
            if not die or die.resting == true then
                restingCount = restingCount + 1
            end
        end
        coroutine.yield(0)
    until restingCount == #diceActive or os.time() > startTime + 3
    watchingDice = false
    --Prints the results if printRollResults is enabled
    if printRollResults == true then
        formatRollResults(color)
    end
    --Automatically deletes the dice if cleanupAfterRoll is 0 or higher
    if cleanupAfterRoll == 0 then
        deleteCurrentDice()
    elseif cleanupAfterRoll > 0 then
        Timer.destroy("cleanupAfterRollTimer")
        Timer.create({
            identifier="cleanupAfterRollTimer", function_name="deleteCurrentDice",
            function_owner=self, delay=cleanupAfterRoll
        })
    end
    return 1
end

--Used to delete dice from previous rolls
function deleteCurrentDice()
    for _, dieGUID in ipairs(diceActive) do
        local die = getObjectFromGUID(dieGUID)
        if die then
            destroyObject(die)
        end
    end
    diceActive = {}
    watchingDice = false
end

--Obtains values for rolls and orders them
function formatRollResults(color)
    local rollResults = {}
    for _, dieGUID in ipairs(diceActive) do
        local die = getObjectFromGUID(dieGUID)
        if die then
            local value = die.getValue()
            table.insert(rollResults, value)
        end
    end
    if organizeRollResults == true then
        local sort_func = function(a,b) return a < b end
        table.sort(rollResults, sort_func)
    end
    convertRollResultsToString(color, rollResults)
end

--Converts the table of roll result numbers into a string and prints
function convertRollResultsToString(color, rollResults)
    local s = "[b]"..Player[color].steam_name .. " rolled:[/b] "
    local addResults = 0
    for i, result in ipairs(rollResults) do
        addResults = addResults + result
        if i < #rollResults then
            s = s .. "[ffffff]" .. result.."[-], "
        else
            s = s .. "[ffffff]" .. result.."[-] = "
        end
    end
    if addResults > 0 then
        s = s .. "[b][ffffff]"..addResults.."[-][/b]"
        broadcastToAll(s, stringColorToRGB(color))
    end
end

--Get a radial position to place item
function getRadialPosition(i, i_max, pos, rot)
    local spokes = 360/i_max
    local posX = pos.x + math.sin( math.rad((spokes*i)+rot.y) ) * radius
    local posY = pos.y + height
    local posZ = pos.z + math.cos( math.rad((spokes*i)+rot.y) ) * radius
    return {x=posX, y=posY, z=posZ}
end

--Gets a random rotation vector
function randomRotation()
    --Credit for this function goes to Revinor (forums)
    --Get 3 random numbers
    local u1 = math.random();
    local u2 = math.random();
    local u3 = math.random();
    --Convert them into quats to avoid gimbal lock
    local u1sqrt = math.sqrt(u1);
    local u1m1sqrt = math.sqrt(1-u1);
    local qx = u1m1sqrt *math.sin(2*math.pi*u2);
    local qy = u1m1sqrt *math.cos(2*math.pi*u2);
    local qz = u1sqrt *math.sin(2*math.pi*u3);
    local qw = u1sqrt *math.cos(2*math.pi*u3);
    --Apply rotation
    local ysqr = qy * qy;
    local t0 = -2.0 * (ysqr + qz * qz) + 1.0;
    local t1 = 2.0 * (qx * qy - qw * qz);
    local t2 = -2.0 * (qx * qz + qw * qy);
    local t3 = 2.0 * (qy * qz - qw * qx);
    local t4 = -2.0 * (qx * qx + ysqr) + 1.0;
    --Correct
    if t2 > 1.0 then t2 = 1.0 end
    if t2 < -1.0 then ts = -1.0 end
    --Convert back to X/Y/Z
    local xr = math.asin(t2);
    local yr = math.atan2(t3, t4);
    local zr = math.atan2(t1, t0);
    --Return result
    return {math.deg(xr),math.deg(yr),math.deg(zr)}
end

--Button creation
function createButtons()
    --Spawns number buttons and assigns a function trigger for each
    for i, pos in ipairs(buttonPositionList) do
        self.createButton({
            click_function="but"..i, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=150, width=150
        })
        local func = function(_,color) numberButtonPressed(i, color) end
        self.setVar("but"..i, func)
    end

    --Spawns deleteCurrentDice button
    self.createButton({
        click_function="deleteCurrentDice", function_owner=self,
        position={0,0,0.73}, height=150, width=150
    })
end

--Data table of positions for number buttons 1-9, in order
buttonPositionList = {
    {-0.435,0,0.59}, {-0.693,0,0.22}, {-0.693,0,-0.22}, {-0.435,0,-0.59},
    {0,0,-0.73}, {0.435,0,-0.59}, {0.693,0,-0.22}, {0.693,0,0.22}, {0.435,0,0.59}
}

        end
    end
    if organizeRollResults == true then
        local sort_func = function(a,b) return a < b end
        table.sort(rollResults, sort_func)
    end
    convertRollResultsToString(color, rollResults)
end

--Converts the table of roll result numbers into a string and prints
function convertRollResultsToString(color, rollResults)
    local s = "[b]"..Player[color].steam_name .. " rolled:[/b] "
    local addResults = 0
    for i, result in ipairs(rollResults) do
        addResults = addResults + result
        if i < #rollResults then
            s = s .. "[ffffff]" .. result.."[-], "
        else
            s = s .. "[ffffff]" .. result.."[-] = "
        end
    end
    if addResults > 0 then
        s = s .. "[b][ffffff]"..addResults.."[-][/b]"
        broadcastToAll(s, stringColorToRGB(color))
    end
end

--Get a radial position to place item
function getRadialPosition(i, i_max, pos, rot)
    local spokes = 360/i_max
    local posX = pos.x + math.sin( math.rad((spokes*i)+rot.y) ) * radius
    local posY = pos.y + height
    local posZ = pos.z + math.cos( math.rad((spokes*i)+rot.y) ) * radius
    return {x=posX, y=posY, z=posZ}
end

--Gets a random rotation vector
function randomRotation()
    --Credit for this function goes to Revinor (forums)
    --Get 3 random numbers
    local u1 = math.random();
    local u2 = math.random();
    local u3 = math.random();
    --Convert them into quats to avoid gimbal lock
    local u1sqrt = math.sqrt(u1);
    local u1m1sqrt = math.sqrt(1-u1);
    local qx = u1m1sqrt *math.sin(2*math.pi*u2);
    local qy = u1m1sqrt *math.cos(2*math.pi*u2);
    local qz = u1sqrt *math.sin(2*math.pi*u3);
    local qw = u1sqrt *math.cos(2*math.pi*u3);
    --Apply rotation
    local ysqr = qy * qy;
    local t0 = -2.0 * (ysqr + qz * qz) + 1.0;
    local t1 = 2.0 * (qx * qy - qw * qz);
    local t2 = -2.0 * (qx * qz + qw * qy);
    local t3 = 2.0 * (qy * qz - qw * qx);
    local t4 = -2.0 * (qx * qx + ysqr) + 1.0;
    --Correct
    if t2 > 1.0 then t2 = 1.0 end
    if t2 < -1.0 then ts = -1.0 end
    --Convert back to X/Y/Z
    local xr = math.asin(t2);
    local yr = math.atan2(t3, t4);
    local zr = math.atan2(t1, t0);
    --Return result
    return {math.deg(xr),math.deg(yr),math.deg(zr)}
end

--Button creation
function createButtons()
    --Spawns number buttons and assigns a function trigger for each
    for i, pos in ipairs(buttonPositionList) do
        self.createButton({
            click_function="but"..i, function_owner=self,
            position=pos, height=150, width=150
        })
        local func = function(_,color) numberButtonPressed(i, color) end
        self.setVar("but"..i, func)
    end

    --Spawns deleteCurrentDice button
    self.createButton({
        click_function="deleteCurrentDice", function_owner=self,
        position={0,0,0.73}, height=150, width=150
    })
end

--Data table of positions for number buttons 1-9, in order
buttonPositionList = {
    {-0.435,0,0.59}, {-0.693,0,0.22}, {-0.693,0,-0.22}, {-0.435,0,-0.59},
    {0,0,-0.73}, {0.435,0,-0.59}, {0.693,0,-0.22}, {0.693,0,0.22}, {0.435,0,0.59}
}

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Assetbundle
ObjectStates.Description: Click on the handle to close.
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
local ConcealedStorageHeight = 3.0
local ConceiledStorageOffset = 10000.0
local StorageState = 1

local BB = {
	Min = {
		x = -16.0,
		y = 41.99,
		z = -50.0
	},
	Max = {
		x = 16.0,
		y = 41.99,
		z = -32.0
	}
}

function onLoad()
    self.interactable = false;
	
    self.createButton({
		label = "",
		click_function = "onButtonClick",
		function_owner = self,
		width = 1000,
		height = 750,
		color = {1, 0, 0, 0.0},
		position = {0, 40.7, 50.5},
		rotation = {-90, 0, 0},
		font_size = 200
    })
	
	if self.getStateId() ~= StorageState then
    Timer.create({
        identifier = ("onAfterLoad" .. self.guid),
        function_name = "onAfterLoad",
        delay = 0.2
    })
	end
end

function onAfterLoad()
	local pos = self.getPosition()
	local bounds = self.getBoundsNormalized()
	local rot = self.getRotation()
	local direction = 1.0
	
	if rot.y == 0 then
		direction = -1.0
	end
	
	BB.Min.x = BB.Min.x + pos.x
	BB.Min.y = BB.Min.y + pos.y - 1.5
	BB.Min.z = (BB.Min.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	BB.Max.x = 	BB.Max.x + pos.x
	BB.Max.y = 	BB.Max.y + pos.y + ConcealedStorageHeight + 0.5
	BB.Max.z = (BB.Max.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	HideObjectsAbove( false )
end

function onButtonClick()
	local currentState = self.getStateId()
	local nextState = 1 + (currentState % 2)
	
	if currentState ~= StorageState then
		HideObjectsAbove( true )
	end
	
	self.setState( nextState )
end

function HideObjectsAbove( toggle )
    local objectsAbove = {}
	local BBMin = { x = BB.Min.x, y = BB.Min.y, z = BB.Min.z }
	local BBMax = { x = BB.Max.x, y = BB.Max.y, z = BB.Max.z }
	
	if not toggle then
		BBMin.y = BBMin.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
		BBMax.y = BBMax.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
	end
    
    for k,v in pairs( getAllObjects() ) do
        if v != self then
            if PointToAABBIntersect( BBMin, BBMax, v.getPosition() ) then
                if toggle then
                    Store( v )
                else
                    Dispense( v )
                end
            end
        end
    end
end

-- Assumes ||min|| < ||max||
function PointToAABBIntersect( min, max, point )
    if IsInRange( point.x, min.x, max.x ) and
       IsInRange( point.y, min.y, max.y ) and
       IsInRange( point.z, min.z, max.z ) then
	   return true
    end
    
    return false
end

function IsInRange( value, a, b )
	local min = 0
	local max = 0
	
	if a > b then
		max = a
		min = b
	else
		max = b
		min = a
	end
	
	if value > min and value < max then
		return true
	end
	
	return false
end

function Store( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local isLocked = obj.getLock()
	
	obj.setVar( "LockStatus", isLocked )
	
    obj.interactable = false
    obj.setLock( true )
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y - ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
end

function Dispense( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local originalLockStatus = obj.getVar( "LockStatus" )
	
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y + ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
	
    obj.interactable = true
	
	if originalLockStatus ~= nil and originalLockStatus == true then
		obj.setLock( true )
	else
		obj.setLock( false )
	end
end

        identifier = ("onAfterLoad" .. self.guid),
        function_name = "onAfterLoad",

	local pos = self.getPosition()
	local bounds = self.getBoundsNormalized()

	BB.Min.y = BB.Min.y + pos.y - 1.5
	BB.Min.z = (BB.Min.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	BB.Max.x = 	BB.Max.x + pos.x
	BB.Max.y = 	BB.Max.y + pos.y + ConcealedStorageHeight + 0.5
	BB.Max.z = (BB.Max.z * direction) + pos.z
	
	HideObjectsAbove( false )
end

function onButtonClick()
	local currentState = self.getStateId()
	local nextState = 1 + (currentState % 2)
	
	if currentState ~= StorageState then
		HideObjectsAbove( true )
	end
	
	self.setState( nextState )
end

function HideObjectsAbove( toggle )
    local objectsAbove = {}
	local BBMin = { x = BB.Min.x, y = BB.Min.y, z = BB.Min.z }
	local BBMax = { x = BB.Max.x, y = BB.Max.y, z = BB.Max.z }
	
	if not toggle then
		BBMin.y = BBMin.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
		BBMax.y = BBMax.y - ConceiledStorageOffset
	end
    
    for k,v in pairs( getAllObjects() ) do
        if v != self then
            if PointToAABBIntersect( BBMin, BBMax, v.getPosition() ) then
                if toggle then
                    Store( v )
                else
                    Dispense( v )
                end
            end
        end
    end
end

-- Assumes ||min|| < ||max||
function PointToAABBIntersect( min, max, point )
    if IsInRange( point.x, min.x, max.x ) and
       IsInRange( point.y, min.y, max.y ) and
       IsInRange( point.z, min.z, max.z ) then
	   return true
    end
    
    return false
end

function IsInRange( value, a, b )
	local min = 0
	local max = 0
	
	if a > b then
		max = a
		min = b
	else
		max = b
		min = a
	end
	
	if value > min and value < max then
		return true
	end
	
	return false
end

function Store( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local isLocked = obj.getLock()
	
	obj.setVar( "LockStatus", isLocked )
	
    obj.interactable = false
    obj.setLock( true )
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y - ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
end

function Dispense( obj )
	local pos = obj.getPosition()
	local originalLockStatus = obj.getVar( "LockStatus" )
	
    obj.setPosition({
        x = pos.x,
        y = pos.y + ConceiledStorageOffset,
        z = pos.z
    })
	
    obj.interactable = true
	
	if originalLockStatus ~= nil and originalLockStatus == true then
		obj.setLock( true )
	else
		obj.setLock( false )
	end
end

		z = -50.0

    self.interactable = false;
	
    self.createButton({
		label = "",

		height = 750,
		color = {1, 0, 0, 0.0},
		position = {0, 40.7, 50.5},
		rotation = {-90, 0, 0},
		font_size = 200
    })
	
	if self.getStateId() ~= StorageState then
    Timer.create({
        identifier = ("onAfterLoad" .. self.guid),
        function_name = "onAfterLoad",
        delay = 0.2
    })
	end
end

function onAfterLoad()
	local pos = self.getPosition()
	local bounds = self.getBoundsNormalized()
	local rot = self.getRotation()
	local direction = 1.0

		min = a
	end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onLoad()
	circle = {
		color             = {0, 0.8, 0.4}, --RGB color of the circle
		radius            = 1,           --radius of the circle around the object
		show              = false,       --should the circle be shown by default?
		steps             = 64,          --number of segments that make up the circle
		thickness         = 0.05,         --thickness of the circle line
		vertical_position = 0.1,           --vertical height of the circle relative to the object
	}
end

function onScriptingButtonDown(index, playerColor)
if Player[playerColor].getHoverObject() == self then
if index == 1 then
circle.radius = 1.5
print('1" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 2 then
circle.radius = 2.5
print('2" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 3 then
circle.radius = 3.5
print('3" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 4 then
circle.radius = 6.5
print('6" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 5 then
circle.radius = 8.5
print('8" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 6 then
circle.radius = 12.5
print('12" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 7 then
circle.radius = 18.5
print('18" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 8 then
circle.radius = 24.5
print('24" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 9 then
circle.radius = 30.5
print('30" circle')
toggleCircle() end
end
end

function toggleCircle()
	circle.show = not circle.show
	if circle.show then
		self.setVectorLines({
			{
				points    = getCircleVectorPoints(circle.radius, circle.steps, circle.vertical_position),
				color     = circle.color,
				thickness = circle.thickness,
				rotation  = {0,0,0},
			}
		})
	else
		self.setVectorLines({})
	end
end

function getCircleVectorPoints(radius, steps, y)
	local t = {}
	local d,s,c,r = 360/steps, math.sin, math.cos, math.rad
	for i = 0,steps do
		table.insert(t, {
			c(r(d*i))*radius,
			y,
			s(r(d*i))*radius
		})
	end
	return t
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.Description: (Press the Green Button to Roll Dice)
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
-- dice tray roller
function onLoad()
    params = {
        click_function = "rollDice",
        function_owner = self,
        position       = {0, 0.25, 0},
        rotation       = {0, 180, 0},
        color          = {0.25, 0.75, 0.25},
        width          = 100,
        height         = 100,
        tooltip        = "Roll",
    }
    self.createButton(params)
end

function rollDice()
    local radius = self.getBoundsNormalized().size.x * 0.917
    local hitList = Physics.cast({
        origin       = self.getPosition(),
        direction    = {0,1,0},
        type         = 2,
        size         = {radius,radius,radius},
        max_distance = 0,
        debug        = false,
    })

    for _, hit in ipairs(hitList) do
        if hit.hit_object.type == "Dice" then
            hit.hit_object.randomize()
        end
    end
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
-- Thanks to Focks for making the script work!
self.createButton({
        label="Quest", click_function="quest", function_owner=self,
        position={-1,.22,3.5}, rotation={0,0,0}, height=500, width=800,
        font_size=250, color={0,0,0}, font_color={.5,.5,.5}
    })
function quest()
      local clockobj = getObjectFromGUID("5f0727") -- use local variables for clarity wherever possible. The computer doesn't mind.
      local clockRotation = clockobj.getRotation()+Vector(0, 32.73, 0)
      clockobj.setRotation(clockRotation)
      local clockTime = 1+(math.floor((clockRotation.y / 30)+0.5)%12) -- transforming the angle into a displayed time (1-12)
      -- math.floor takes the number without decimal places. Adding 0.5 to the number before you floor it is how you round in lua
      -- the % is a modulo operator. it returns the remainder of the expression on its left divided by the one on its right.
      -- X%12 would return a value in the range 0 to 11. Adding 1 brings it to 1 to 12, which makes the if statement easier.
      if clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 1 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 6", {.5,.5,.5})
        elseif clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 2 then
              broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 6", {.5,.5,.5})
      elseif clockTime >= 2 and clockTime <= 3 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 7", {.5,.5,.5})
        elseif clockTime >= 3 and clockTime <= 4 then
            broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 8", {.5,.5,.5})
          elseif clockTime >= 4 and clockTime <= 5 then
              broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 9", {.5,.5,.5})
            elseif clockTime >= 5 and clockTime <= 6 then
                broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 10", {.5,.5,.5})
              elseif clockTime >= 6 and clockTime <= 7 then
                  broadcastToAll("Adventure awaits!", {.5,.5,.5})
                elseif clockTime >= 7 and clockTime <= 8 then
                    broadcastToAll("The journey begins. The Quest is at level 1", {.5,.5,.5})
                  elseif clockTime >= 8 and clockTime <= 9 then
                      broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 2", {.5,.5,.5})
                    elseif clockTime >= 9 and clockTime <= 10 then
                        broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 3", {.5,.5,.5})
                      elseif clockTime >= 10 and clockTime <= 11 then
                            broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 4", {.5,.5,.5})
      elseif clockTime == 12 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 5", {.5,.5,.5})
      else
          broadcastToAll("Quest", {.5,.5,.5})
      end
      end




self.createButton({
        label="Time", click_function="time", function_owner=self,
        position={1,.22,3.5}, rotation={0,0,0}, height=500, width=800,
        font_size=250, color={0,0,0}, font_color={0.700, 0.392, 0.113}
    })
function time()
        local clockobj = getObjectFromGUID("eaaaa2") -- use local variables for clarity wherever possible. The computer doesn't mind.
        local clockRotation = clockobj.getRotation()+Vector(0, 30, 0)
        clockobj.setRotation(clockRotation)
        local clockTime = 1+(math.floor((clockRotation.y / 30)+0.5)%12) -- transforming the angle into a displayed time (1-12)
        -- math.floor takes the number without decimal places. Adding 0.5 to the number before you floor it is how you round in lua
        -- the % is a modulo operator. it returns the remainder of the expression on its left divided by the one on its right.
        -- X%12 would return a value in the range 0 to 11. Adding 1 brings it to 1 to 12, which makes the if statement easier.
        if clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 1 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 5 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
          elseif clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 2 then
                broadcastToAll("It is 4 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        elseif clockTime >= 2 and clockTime <= 3 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 3 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
          elseif clockTime >= 3 and clockTime <= 4 then
              broadcastToAll("It is 2 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
            elseif clockTime >= 4 and clockTime <= 5 then
                broadcastToAll("It is 1 hour until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
              elseif clockTime >= 5 and clockTime <= 6 then
                  broadcastToAll("Beware! Night has fallen!",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                elseif clockTime >= 6 and clockTime <= 7 then
                    broadcastToAll("A new day dawns!",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                  elseif clockTime >= 7 and clockTime <= 8 then
                      broadcastToAll("It is 10 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                    elseif clockTime >= 8 and clockTime <= 9 then
                        broadcastToAll("It is 9 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                      elseif clockTime >= 9 and clockTime <= 10 then
                          broadcastToAll("It is 8 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                        elseif clockTime >= 10 and clockTime <= 11 then
                              broadcastToAll("It is 7 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        elseif clockTime == 12 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 6 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        else
            broadcastToAll("Night",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        end
end

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: When an activation dice would be placed in a space that contains a diseased token, change its score to 1. When a diseased hostile is attacked, if the attack roll is a success, change the result to a critical success.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: Heroes that are trapped cannot make Move (I+) or Run (3+) actions. A trapped hero or an adjacent hero can spend a 4+ activation dice to remove a trapped token. While a hostile is trapped, if it would make a Move action it does not. Remove hostiles' trapped tokens after the event roll in the event phase.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: After a hero activates, before they make any actions, if they have a fatigued token, change all their activation dice scores to 1. Then discard that hero's fatigued token.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: While a hero or hostile is cursed, increase the Damage value of all weapon actions that target that model by +1/+2.

ContainedObjects.Description: When an activation dice would be placed in a space that contains a diseased token, change its score to 1. When a diseased hostile is attacked, if the attack roll is a success, change the result to a critical success.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: Heroes that are trapped cannot make Move (I+) or Run (3+) actions. A trapped hero or an adjacent hero can spend a 4+ activation dice to remove a trapped token. While a hostile is trapped, if it would make a Move action it does not. Remove hostiles' trapped tokens after the event roll in the event phase.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.Description: After a hero activates, before they make any actions, if they have a fatigued token, change all their activation dice scores to 1. Then discard that hero's fatigued token.

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
function onLoad()
	circle = {
		color             = {0, 0.8, 0.4}, --RGB color of the circle
		radius            = 1,           --radius of the circle around the object
		show              = false,       --should the circle be shown by default?
		steps             = 64,          --number of segments that make up the circle
		thickness         = 0.05,         --thickness of the circle line
		vertical_position = 0.1,           --vertical height of the circle relative to the object
	}
end

function onScriptingButtonDown(index, playerColor)
if Player[playerColor].getHoverObject() == self then
if index == 1 then
circle.radius = 1.5
print('1" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 2 then
circle.radius = 2.5
print('2" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 3 then
circle.radius = 3.5
print('3" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 4 then
circle.radius = 6.5
print('6" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 5 then
circle.radius = 8.5
print('8" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 6 then
circle.radius = 12.5
print('12" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 7 then
circle.radius = 18.5
print('18" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 8 then
circle.radius = 24.5
print('24" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 9 then
circle.radius = 30.5
print('30" circle')
toggleCircle() end
end
end

function toggleCircle()
	circle.show = not circle.show
	if circle.show then
		self.setVectorLines({
			{
				points    = getCircleVectorPoints(circle.radius, circle.steps, circle.vertical_position),
				color     = circle.color,
				thickness = circle.thickness,
				rotation  = {0,0,0},
			}
		})
	else
		self.setVectorLines({})
	end
end

function getCircleVectorPoints(radius, steps, y)
	local t = {}
	local d,s,c,r = 360/steps, math.sin, math.cos, math.rad
	for i = 0,steps do
		table.insert(t, {
			c(r(d*i))*radius,
			y,
			s(r(d*i))*radius
		})
	end
	return t
end

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Model
ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
function onLoad()
	circle = {
		color             = {0, 0.8, 0.4}, --RGB color of the circle
		radius            = 1,           --radius of the circle around the object
		show              = false,       --should the circle be shown by default?
		steps             = 64,          --number of segments that make up the circle
		thickness         = 0.05,         --thickness of the circle line
		vertical_position = 0.1,           --vertical height of the circle relative to the object
	}
end

function onScriptingButtonDown(index, playerColor)
if Player[playerColor].getHoverObject() == self then
if index == 1 then
circle.radius = 1.5
print('1" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 2 then
circle.radius = 2.5
print('2" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 3 then
circle.radius = 3.5
print('3" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 4 then
circle.radius = 6.5
print('6" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 5 then
circle.radius = 8.5
print('8" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 6 then
circle.radius = 12.5
print('12" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 7 then
circle.radius = 18.5
print('18" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 8 then
circle.radius = 24.5
print('24" circle')
toggleCircle() end
if index == 9 then
circle.radius = 30.5
print('30" circle')
toggleCircle() end
end
end

function toggleCircle()
	circle.show = not circle.show
	if circle.show then
		self.setVectorLines({
			{
				points    = getCircleVectorPoints(circle.radius, circle.steps, circle.vertical_position),
				color     = circle.color,
				thickness = circle.thickness,
				rotation  = {0,0,0},
			}
		})
	else
		self.setVectorLines({})
	end
end

function getCircleVectorPoints(radius, steps, y)
	local t = {}
	local d,s,c,r = 360/steps, math.sin, math.cos, math.rad
	for i = 0,steps do
		table.insert(t, {
			c(r(d*i))*radius,
			y,
			s(r(d*i))*radius
		})
	end
	return t
end

ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
-- Thanks to Focks for making the script work!
self.createButton({
        label="Quest", click_function="quest", function_owner=self,
        position={-1,.22,3.5}, rotation={0,0,0}, height=500, width=800,
        font_size=250, color={0,0,0}, font_color={.5,.5,.5}
    })
function quest()
      local clockobj = getObjectFromGUID("5f0727") -- use local variables for clarity wherever possible. The computer doesn't mind.
      local clockRotation = clockobj.getRotation()+Vector(0, 32.73, 0)
      clockobj.setRotation(clockRotation)
      local clockTime = 1+(math.floor((clockRotation.y / 30)+0.5)%12) -- transforming the angle into a displayed time (1-12)
      -- math.floor takes the number without decimal places. Adding 0.5 to the number before you floor it is how you round in lua
      -- the % is a modulo operator. it returns the remainder of the expression on its left divided by the one on its right.
      -- X%12 would return a value in the range 0 to 11. Adding 1 brings it to 1 to 12, which makes the if statement easier.
      if clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 1 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 6", {.5,.5,.5})
        elseif clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 2 then
              broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 6", {.5,.5,.5})
      elseif clockTime >= 2 and clockTime <= 3 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 7", {.5,.5,.5})
        elseif clockTime >= 3 and clockTime <= 4 then
            broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 8", {.5,.5,.5})
          elseif clockTime >= 4 and clockTime <= 5 then
              broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 9", {.5,.5,.5})
            elseif clockTime >= 5 and clockTime <= 6 then
                broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 10", {.5,.5,.5})
              elseif clockTime >= 6 and clockTime <= 7 then
                  broadcastToAll("Adventure awaits!", {.5,.5,.5})
                elseif clockTime >= 7 and clockTime <= 8 then
                    broadcastToAll("The journey begins. The Quest is at level 1", {.5,.5,.5})
                  elseif clockTime >= 8 and clockTime <= 9 then
                      broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 2", {.5,.5,.5})
                    elseif clockTime >= 9 and clockTime <= 10 then
                        broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 3", {.5,.5,.5})
                      elseif clockTime >= 10 and clockTime <= 11 then
                            broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 4", {.5,.5,.5})
      elseif clockTime == 12 then
          broadcastToAll("The journey continues. The Quest has advanced to level 5", {.5,.5,.5})
      else
          broadcastToAll("Quest", {.5,.5,.5})
      end
      end




self.createButton({
        label="Time", click_function="time", function_owner=self,
        position={1,.22,3.5}, rotation={0,0,0}, height=500, width=800,
        font_size=250, color={0,0,0}, font_color={0.700, 0.392, 0.113}
    })
function time()
        local clockobj = getObjectFromGUID("eaaaa2") -- use local variables for clarity wherever possible. The computer doesn't mind.
        local clockRotation = clockobj.getRotation()+Vector(0, 30, 0)
        clockobj.setRotation(clockRotation)
        local clockTime = 1+(math.floor((clockRotation.y / 30)+0.5)%12) -- transforming the angle into a displayed time (1-12)
        -- math.floor takes the number without decimal places. Adding 0.5 to the number before you floor it is how you round in lua
        -- the % is a modulo operator. it returns the remainder of the expression on its left divided by the one on its right.
        -- X%12 would return a value in the range 0 to 11. Adding 1 brings it to 1 to 12, which makes the if statement easier.
        if clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 1 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 5 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
          elseif clockTime >= 1 and clockTime <= 2 then
                broadcastToAll("It is 4 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        elseif clockTime >= 2 and clockTime <= 3 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 3 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
          elseif clockTime >= 3 and clockTime <= 4 then
              broadcastToAll("It is 2 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
            elseif clockTime >= 4 and clockTime <= 5 then
                broadcastToAll("It is 1 hour until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
              elseif clockTime >= 5 and clockTime <= 6 then
                  broadcastToAll("Beware! Night has fallen!",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                elseif clockTime >= 6 and clockTime <= 7 then
                    broadcastToAll("A new day dawns!",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                  elseif clockTime >= 7 and clockTime <= 8 then
                      broadcastToAll("It is 10 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                    elseif clockTime >= 8 and clockTime <= 9 then
                        broadcastToAll("It is 9 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                      elseif clockTime >= 9 and clockTime <= 10 then
                          broadcastToAll("It is 8 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
                        elseif clockTime >= 10 and clockTime <= 11 then
                              broadcastToAll("It is 7 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        elseif clockTime == 12 then
            broadcastToAll("It is 6 hours until Nightfall...",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        else
            broadcastToAll("Night",{0.700, 0.392, 0.113})
        end
end

ContainedObjects.Description: Heroes that are trapped cannot make Move (I+) or Run (3+) actions. A trapped hero or an adjacent hero can spend a 4+ activation dice to remove a trapped token. While a hostile is trapped, if it would make a Move action it does not. Remove hostiles' trapped tokens after the event roll in the event phase.

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.Description: (Press the Green Button to Roll Dice)
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
-- dice tray roller
function onLoad()
    params = {
        click_function = "rollDice",
        function_owner = self,
        position       = {0, 0.25, 0},
        rotation       = {0, 180, 0},
        color          = {0.25, 0.75, 0.25},
        width          = 100,
        height         = 100,
        tooltip        = "Roll",
    }
    self.createButton(params)
end

function rollDice()
    local radius = self.getBoundsNormalized().size.x * 0.917
    local hitList = Physics.cast({
        origin       = self.getPosition(),
        direction    = {0,1,0},
        type         = 2,
        size         = {radius,radius,radius},
        max_distance = 0,
        debug        = false,
    })

    for _, hit in ipairs(hitList) do
        if hit.hit_object.type == "Dice" then
            hit.hit_object.randomize()
        end
    end
end

ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onLoad()
    self.interactable = false;
    self.createButton({
    label = "CUSTOMIZE BOARD",
    click_function = "onButtonClick",
    function_owner = self,
    width = 750,
    height = 75,
    color = {1, 1, 1, 1.0},
    position = {-15.5, 10, -5},
    rotation = {180, 270, 80},
    font_size = 75
})
end

function onButtonClick()
    if self.interactable == false then
        self.interactable = true;
        self.setColorTint({1, 1, 1})
        self.editButton({ label = "LOCK BOARD" })

    else
        self.interactable = false;
        self.editButton({ label = "CUSTOMIZE BOARD"})

    end
end

ObjectStates.Description: The Cursed City mod for Tabletop Simulator was made possible thanks to the hard work and dedication of a handful of talented Warhammer fans that wished to help people connect and share their favorite hobby in the time of Covid. The project was organized by Mothman Zack. His dream team of modders included; Brady, Nylon, TheFraggDog, Eternal3lade and more!

Looking for other wargamers to play on Tabletop Simulator? Then check out the TTS Warhammer 40k Discord. Here you will also find the MMZ Battle-Forge, which has TTS mods for Warhammer 40K, Age of Sigmar, Blood Bowl and more! Check it out at...
